column1: Nainwan is a tehsil of Bundi district and a municipality in the Hadoti region of the state of Rajasthan in India.
== Geography ==
Nainwan is located at 25.77°N 75.85°E﻿ / 25.77; 75.85. It has an average elevation of 291 metres (954 feet).The town is situated at a distance of 95 km from Kota
column3: and 65 km from Bundi. There is no rail network in the town. The nearest railway station is in Indergarh
column4: at a distance of 25 km from Nainwa.

column1: Tourism attraction in the area include the Talwas Lake
column2: Paibalapura Dam and Ranthambore National Park. The main source of water in Nainwa is the Paibalapura dam.

column1: == History ==
The town was named by prince Kunwar Nain Singh.
The town contains many stepwell reservoirs known as baoris. Gadpol
column3: Deipol and Khanpol are the four large entrance gates. The town also houses numerous temples
column4: including 10 Jain temples .A large temple in the town is Mansha Puran Ganesh Ji.

column1: The town is the resting place of the king of Bundi.
== Education ==
There is a college named Bhagvan Adinath Jairaj Marwara College
column3: 2 km from main city and affiliated with Kota University. There is a senior secondary school and a secondary school for girls. There are around 50 private schools
column4: out of which more than 5 are of 10+2 level.

column5: English Compulsory & Literature) and competitive exams. EduPoint Nainwa also provides free education on YouTube channel "EduPoint Nainwa". EduPoint has batches from class 5 to 12.

column1: == Festivals and fair ==
People of Nainwa celebrate many Indian festivals including Bundi Utsav
column2: Teej and Muharram. A fair named Dahelwal Ji takes place in the town. Jajawar झेटाल mata mandir is famous for its fair (7 days ).People of Saini caste worship Mataji

column1: == Transportation ==
There is a bus stop in the town
column2: through which many private and more than 50 government buses go. A state highway and a national highway connect the town to the cities of Rajasthan. Nearest large railway stations are in Kota and Sawai Madahopur. Nearest Airport is Sanganer Airport in Jaipur.

column1: == Food ==
Nainva is known for its unique sweet named "Nainwa ka Petha"
column2: made with pure ghee. It resembles the Indian sweet Gulab jamun.
